text:
Freelancers, entrepreneurs, founders of early stage startups, and co-founders. I need your help.

If you were given the option to outsource your bookkeeping, which will reduce your cost by 60%-70%, would you go for it? If no, why not?

text: <https://superpath.co/blog/survey-what-are-the-best-marketing-books>

attachments.title: Survey: What are the best marketing books? - Superpath
attachments.text: We asked the Content Career Growth Slack community about their favorite marketing books, and they delivered. Here are the books we've collected so far. These are not in any particular order and I've included any comments left by our community members. Tip: Use the Library Extension Chrome plugin to see if these books are available from your local library. It can look for paperback, hardcover, ebook and audio versions: <https://www.libraryextension.com/> Disclaimer: There are affiliate links on t

text: Hey folks! :wave::skin-tone-2: Jo from Animas Coaching here and I've been assigned to PR (from Marketing Outreach specialist)... I don't know where to start!! :sweat_smile: Can anyone point me to any course/resource on PR stuff or how I get journalist mentions/coverage? Thanks in advance for your help! :heart:

elements.text: Hey folks!
Jo from Animas Coaching here and I've been assigned to PR (from Marketing Outreach specialist)... I don't know where to start!!
Can anyone point me to any course/resource on PR stuff or how I get journalist mentions/coverage? Thanks in advance for your help!

text:
At the most basic level: find them and interact with them. Once they become a warm (ish) contact, it’s easier to approach with a press release, story, product launch etc.

I have a database of every analyst and journal in my industry. It tracks that we follow and interact with them on a regular basis,  what they’re relevant articles are about, and whether they actually respond to us.

Over time, most of them have moved onto a new tab: friends!

elements.text: At the most basic level: find them and interact with them. Once they become a warm (ish) contact, it’s easier to approach with a press release, story, product launch etc.

I have a database of every analyst and journal in my industry. It tracks that we follow and interact with them on a regular basis,  what they’re relevant articles are about, and whether they actually respond to us.
Over time, most of them have moved onto a new tab: friends!

text: Got it , create a database of press people first and build relationships, awesome tip! Thank you <@UJJFDTN8G>

elements.text: Got it , create a database of press people first and build relationships, awesome tip! Thank you
